id2.name: Kumkum Bagchi
bio_content: Was introduced to music at the tender age of 4 whilst in London, under the guidance of Ms. Arati Bhattacharya, an eminent artist from AIR
She continued her journey after moving to India, with various teachers, including the late Mr. Nityananda Mitra, who was a student of Ashoktaru Bandyopadhya

Kumkum has completed Sangeet Ratna (Masters) in Rabindrasangeet, with distinction,  from Bangiya Sangeet Parishad, which is affiliated to Rabindra Bharati University and which is recognized by Indira Kala Sangeet Vishwa Vidyalaya, Khairagarh, M.P
In addition, she holds a Sangeet Visharad (Graduation) in Hindustani Classical Music from Prayag Sangeet Samiti, affiliated to Allahabad University
A Graduate in Physics, she is also a University Gold Medalist - MBA (Information Systems and Operations Research) and  a University topper for all streams

Her journey in music continues under the guidance of Ms. Shreya Guhathakurta, Dr. Debashish Raichaudhuri, Ms. Apala Basu Sen, Ms. Pramita Chatterjee and Dr. Soumyendu Guha for Ranindrasangeet and Pandit Sanjoy Banerjee for Hindustani Classical Music
Kumkum has been a student of Kahlar since 2013 and under the mentorship of Dr. Soumyendu Guha, has been performing in the USA as well as abroad alongwith other Kahlar students
She currently resides in the Washington DC Metro area, USA and works as an IT Program Manager

id3.name: Faisal Quader
bio_content: Started music at the age of 4 with family, especially his sister
Participated in a well-known Children’s TV program - “Notun Kuri” in Dhaka and other district level competitions at the age of 6 & beyond and stood first
Started learning Rabindra Sangeet at “Chhayanot” and completed 3rd year when he left for US at the age of 18 for studies. Also learned Sitar at Chayanot for 3 years prior to that at a young age
Faisal holds a Bachelors and a Masters in Computer Science &  Engineering and is currently wrapping up a PhD in Data science & Cybersecurity from the University of Maryland

He is Currently learning and practicing Rabindra Sangeet at Kahlar under Dr. Soumyendu Guha along with many other well renowned  Gurus such as Dr. Debashish Raychaudhuri, Ms. Shreya Guhathakurta and Dr. Shamik Pal

id6.name: Sangeeta Ganguly
bio_content: Trained in Rabindrasangeet from Dakshinee
Graduated with distinction from Dakshinee in 1989
Awarded Dakshinee Puroshkar in 1990 in recognition of young talent for Rabindrasangeet
After graduating from Dakshinee underwent 8 years of advanced Rabindrasangeet training under the guidance of Mr. Rano Guhathakurta
Sangeeta has performed in various programs in  India and North America
She has been performing  for Kahlar as well as other groups  in different cities of North America since 2003
Sangeeta currently lives and works as an IT Professional in Colorado

id16.name: Nazia Nawshad Shawon
bio_content: Nazia’s passion for music started at a very tender age in 1982 when she was a second grader. Her parents were avid listeners of Tagore music. Their love for this eminent poet has determined her fate as a Tagore musician. Her mother was a folk song-lover so she decided to train her in both types of music - Tagore and Folk
In 1982 she was first trained in folk music by Ms. Chandana Majumdar the famous Lalon Sangeet singer of Bangladesh

Beginning of 1983 her Rabindra Sangeet training started by Ms. Nilufer Sultana Khuku who was a student of Mr. Ajit Ray the eminent Bangladeshi Tagore musician. Under her supervision she continued to learn Tagore music for 11 years till 1994
In 1999 for a few months she was trained by Ms. Mita Haq the famous Bangladeshi Tagore musician

Nazia moved to US in 2001. In 2008 she got introduced to Kahlar and Dr. Soumyendu Guha. Since then her music journey continues in US. Currently she is learning and practicing Rabindrasangeet at Kahlar and under the mentorship of Dr. Soumyendu Guha she has been performing in USA along with other Kahlar students
Since 2017 she has started taking lessons from Ms. Shreya Guhathakurta and Dr. Debashish Raychaudhuri
Nazia also holds a Bachelor’s and Masters in English Literature from Dhaka University. In her secondary exam Nazia was a board stand from Dhaka board
In US, Nazia pursued her career in technical writing and business analysis. Currently she resides in the Washington DC Metro area, USA

id18.name: Rajdeep Bhaduri
bio_content: Inspiration and love to learn Rabindrasangeet started at home from Mother, Grandmother and Aunt
Learnt classical music from Ustad Rabiul Hossain in Rajshahi for two years
Learnt tabla from Rajsahi Shilpokola Academy for one year
Learnt Rabindrasangeet from Ms. Banani Ghosh for one year
Currently learning Rabindrasangeet from Ms. Shreya Guhathakurta, Dr. Debashish Raychaudhuri and Dr. Soumyendu Guha
Occasionally takes tabla lessons from Mr. Debu Nayak
An Engineering graduate and IT Professional living in the Washington DC Metro area

id22.name: Surantari
id22.description: In 2004, Kahlar produced Gitabitan-Live-2, compiled by Dakshinee, which comprises of 683 Tagore songs, dance dramas like Chitrangada., Shyama and Chandalika and operas like Balmiki Pratibha and Mayar Khela. These creations of Tagore, one of modern India's greatest poets and a Nobel laureate, are in a set of compact discs with original notations. The text of the lyrics is available in both Bangla and English. Available for purchase now at our Kahlar, Silver Spring location, MD, USA for $40

id23.name: Gitobitan Live
id23.description: n 2017, Kahlar produced an album “Surantari-Chhandantari-Pathantori” in collaboration with Hindustan Record of Kolkata. Eminent Rabindrasangeet Artistes from Kolkata, India, have come together in this album to produce an album which is one of its kind. This album is based on Tagore’s songs which have somewhat similar lyrics but different rhythms and tunes. Available for purchase now on Amazon.in: https://www.amazon.in/Surantori-Chhandantori-Pathantori. Also available at our Kahlar, Silver Spring location, MD, USA for $10
